name: S3CorsConfigurationRule
description: Describes cross-origin access rules for the Amazon S3 Cors Configuration property.

properties.name: AllowedHeaders
properties.desc: Headers that are specified in the Access-Control-Request-Headers header. These headers are allowed in a preflight OPTIONS request. In response to any preflight OPTIONS request, Amazon S3 returns any requested headers that are allowed.

properties.name: AllowedMethods
properties.desc: An HTTP method that you allow the origin to execute. The valid values are GET, PUT, HEAD, POST, and DELETE.

properties.name: AllowedOrigins
properties.desc: An origin that you allow to send cross-domain requests.

properties.name: ExposedHeaders
properties.desc: One or more headers in the response that are accessible to client applications (for example, from a JavaScript XMLHttpRequest object).

properties.name: Id
properties.desc: A unique identifier for this rule. The value cannot be more than 255 characters.

properties.name: MaxAge
properties.desc: The time in seconds that your browser is to cache the preflight response for the specified resource.
